lead_paragraph: The plan for Moynihan Station ultimately calls for moving Amtrak’s ticket windows and waiting rooms from Penn Station into the James A. Farley Post Office across Eighth Avenue. But it will hardly affect 95 percent of the commuters who use Penn Station now. Here’s a proposal to help. Move Madison Square Garden to the current site of the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center, which Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo imagines moving to Queens, and create a new light-filled Penn Station.
